page.title: 11Buxhall - The Thatcher
page.content: The local thatcher began thatching in 1969 as an apprentice. He is a member of the{Suffolk Master Thatchers Assoc- {iation,}which aims to maintain the best traditional standards of thatching in East Anglia. His business is run with a partner and "apprentice" although he generally works by himself anywhere in Suffolk up to 70km from home. Half the work is complete rethatching, the remainder is repair. He harvests all the materials used -{reeds}from Norfolk, and{straw}locally using a sail-reaper.{Broatches,}for pegging the straw, and{liggers,}for the decoration on the capping, are made from{osiers or nuttery}(hazel) both gathered locally. He thatches all year but dislikes heavy rain and cannot work in severe frost or snow. Then he can make his tools and equipment.
